intro: Calandrinia polyandra, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant pink to red flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to drought conditions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Calandrinia polyandra is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
